description:
Reentrancy in MyERC1155Token.tradeToken(uint256,uint256,uint256) (contracts/ERC1155token.sol#76-97):
	External calls:
	- _burn(msg.sender,giveTokenId,giveAmount) (contracts/ERC1155token.sol#95)
		- response = IERC1155Receiver(to).onERC1155Received(operator,from,id,value,data) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#390-405)
		- response = IERC1155Receiver(to).onERC1155BatchReceived(operator,from,ids,values,data) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#422-439)
	- _mint(msg.sender,receiveTokenId,giveAmount,) (contracts/ERC1155token.sol#96)
		- response = IERC1155Receiver(to).onERC1155Received(operator,from,id,value,data) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#390-405)
		- response = IERC1155Receiver(to).onERC1155BatchReceived(operator,from,ids,values,data) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#422-439)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _mint(msg.sender,receiveTokenId,giveAmount,) (contracts/ERC1155token.sol#96)
		- _balances[id][from] = fromBalance - value (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#166)
		- _balances[id][to] += value (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#171)
	ERC1155._balances (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#23) can be used in cross function reentrancies:
	- ERC1155._update(address,address,uint256[],uint256[]) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#148-182)
	- ERC1155.balanceOf(address,uint256) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#64-66)

		- [_balances[id][to] += value](node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#L171)
	[ERC1155._balances](node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC1155/ERC1155.sol#L23) can be used in cross function reentrancies:

elements.name: require(bool,string)(block.timestamp >= lastMintTime[msg.sender][id] + 60,There is a cooldown of 1 minute between free mints.)

description:
Math.mulDiv(uint256,uint256,uint256) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#123-202) has bitwise-xor operator ^ instead of the exponentiation operator **: 
	 - inverse = (3 * denominator) ^ 2 (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#184)
markdown:
[Math.mulDiv(uint256,uint256,uint256)](node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#L123-L202) has bitwise-xor operator ^ instead of the exponentiation operator **: 
	 - [inverse = (3 * denominator) ^ 2](node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#L184)

description:
Math.mulDiv(uint256,uint256,uint256) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#123-202) performs a multiplication on the result of a division:
	- denominator = denominator / twos (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#169)
	- inverse = (3 * denominator) ^ 2 (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#184)
markdown:
[Math.mulDiv(uint256,uint256,uint256)](node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#L123-L202) performs a multiplication on the result of a division:
	- [denominator = denominator / twos](node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#L169)
	- [inverse = (3 * denominator) ^ 2](node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#L184)

description:
Math.mulDiv(uint256,uint256,uint256) (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#123-202) performs a multiplication on the result of a division:
	- denominator = denominator / twos (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#169)
	- inverse *= 2 - denominator * inverse (node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol#188)
